Somerville.Rufus Lamson House:
Rufus Lamson House is an historic house at 72–74 Hampshire Street in Cambridge, Massachusetts, a few blocks from the Lamson Place.
The house was apparently built and owned by Rufus Lamson (October 2, 1809 – July 13, 1879) and then inherited by his widow Mary Jane Lamson (Butler) (1812 – Unknown) whom he married at Boston, on Thanksgiving Eve, 1832. Rufus Lamson was a stonemason and a large holder of real estate, known for his liberal treatment of the landlord and tenant relation.
